game_welcome.title: Improve your Requirements Skills
game_welcome.description: Each game is an opportunity to enhance your requirements analysis and specification abilities. Ready for the next challenge? Enter the game code and start playing.

levels_welcome.title: Create Learning Challenges
levels_welcome.description: As a teacher, you have the opportunity to create meaningful learning experiences. Design games that help your students develop skills in requirements specification through practical classification and construction exercises.

modal.title: Select Game Type
modal.subtitle: What type of game would you like to create?

classification.title: Requirements Classification
classification.description: Students will learn to identify and classify ambiguous and non-ambiguous requirements.

construction.title: Requirements Construction
construction.description: Students will practice correct requirement construction from fragments.

game_code_info.title: Game Code
game_code_info.description: The game code is a unique identifier that allows students to join the game you have created.

game_code_info.point2: The code is unique and cannot be modified.
game_code_info.point3: Students will need this code to access the activity from the 'Game' section.

time.title: Total Time

progressive_accuracy.description: Percentage indicating the accumulated accuracy in requirement construction.

correct.description: Number of requirements correctly classified in this attempt.

incorrect.title: Incorrect Requirements
incorrect.description: Number of requirements incorrectly classified in this attempt.

success_precision.title: Success Precision
success_precision.description: Percentage of accuracy in correctly classified requirements.

error_precision.title: Error Precision
error_precision.description: Percentage of inaccuracy in incorrectly classified requirements.

progressive_precision.title: Progressive Precision
progressive_precision.description: Cumulative precision percentage considering all attempts made.

date.title: Attempt Date
date.description: Date and time this classification attempt was made.

modal.title: Generate Report
modal.select_option: What do you want to do with the report?

metrics_explanation.average_description: Represents the mean of correctly classified requirements per attempt. Calculated as:
metrics_explanation.average_formula: Average = (Total correct requirements) / (Total number of attempts)
metrics_explanation.average_interpretation: A higher value indicates better accuracy in requirement classification.
metrics_explanation.consistency_description: Combined measure that evaluates both performance stability and improvement trend. Composed of two factors:
metrics_explanation.improvement_formula: Improvement = Average of positive increments between consecutive attempts
metrics_explanation.consistency_interpretation: A higher value (100%) indicates perfectly stable performance with constant improvement. Considered as:
consistency_levels: High (‚â•75%): Very stable performance with positive trend
Low (<50%): Variable performance or no clear improvement

explanation.title: Column Descriptions
explanation.attempt: Sequential number indicating the order of each attempt made.
explanation.time: Total duration taken to complete the attempt.
explanation.movements: Total number of classification actions performed during the attempt.
explanation.requirements: Total number of requirements available for classification in the attempt.
explanation.precision_success: Percentage representing the accuracy of correct classifications, calculated as (Correct/Total) √ó 100.
explanation.precision_errors: Percentage representing the error rate in classifications, calculated as (Incorrect/Total) √ó 100.
explanation.precision_progressive: Metric reflecting the cumulative improvement in the student's precision over their attempts.

summary.progress_record: has recorded their progress in the game, accumulating a total playing time of
summary.game_identified: The game is identified under the unique code
summary.last_attempt_prefix: and their last attempt was made on

average_accuracy.title: Average Accuracy
average_accuracy.description: Represents the general average of the average accuracies achieved by each player. Each player's accuracy is calculated by averaging the accuracies obtained in all their attempts per requirement.

formula.step1: 1. Accuracy per attempt = (Correctly placed fragments / Total fragments) √ó 100
formula.step2: 2. Player's average accuracy = Sum of accuracies from all attempts / Total attempts
formula.step3: 3. General average accuracy = Sum of players' average accuracies / Total players

average_accuracy.interpretation: This metric reflects the overall accuracy of the game, considering all attempts by each player for each requirement. A higher value indicates a better general ability of players to construct requirements correctly.

average_game_time.title: Average Game Time
average_game_time.description: Represents the average time it takes to complete the entire game, calculated from each player's total time.

formula.step1: 1. Player's total time = Sum of time spent on all requirements
formula.step2: 2. Average game time = Sum of all players' total times / Total players

average_game_time.interpretation: This metric provides an overview of the time needed to complete all requirements in the game.

average_time.title: Average Time per Requirement
average_time.description: Represents the average time it takes players to correctly complete each requirement, considering all their attempts until success.

formula.step1: 1. Player's total time per requirement = Sum of times from all attempts on the requirement
formula.step2: 2. Average time per requirement = Sum of all players' total times / Total players

average_time.interpretation: This metric helps identify which requirements take longer to be constructed correctly, which may indicate their level of complexity.

average_attempts.title: Average Attempts
average_attempts.description: Indicates the average number of attempts players need to correctly construct each requirement.

formula.step1: 1. Attempts per requirement = Number of attempts until correct completion
formula.step2: 2. Average attempts per requirement = Sum of all players' attempts / Total players

average_attempts.interpretation: A higher average number of attempts suggests that the requirement is more challenging or complex to construct correctly.

completion_rate.title: Completion Rate
completion_rate.description: Indicates the percentage of players who have completed all requirements in the game.
completion_rate.formula: Completion Rate = (Players who completed / Total players) √ó 100
completion_rate.interpretation: A rate of 66.67% indicates that two-thirds of the players have successfully completed all requirements.

difficulty_index.title: Difficulty Index
difficulty_index.description: Uses the average number of attempts to determine which requirements are more challenging.
difficulty_index.formula: Average Attempts = Total attempts per requirement / Number of players
difficulty_index.interpretation: A higher average of attempts indicates greater difficulty in requirement construction.

challenging_requirements.title: Most Challenging Requirements
challenging_requirements.subtitle: Top 3 requirements that required the most attempts

first_attempt_accuracy.title: First Attempt Accuracy
first_attempt_accuracy.description: Represents the percentage of requirements that were correctly classified by players on their first attempt.
first_attempt_accuracy.formula: Accuracy = (Correctly classified requirements on first attempt / Total requirements) √ó 100
first_attempt_accuracy.interpretation: A higher value indicates a better initial understanding of the difference between ambiguous and non-ambiguous requirements. This is an important indicator of the clarity of requirement ambiguity concepts.

error_rate.title: Error Rate per Requirement
error_rate.description: Indicates the percentage of players who incorrectly classified a specific requirement. This metric helps identify the most challenging requirements.
error_rate.formula: Error Rate = (Players who classified incorrectly / Total players) √ó 100
error_rate.interpretation: A high rate may indicate that the requirement is particularly challenging or may need clarification in its wording. It's useful for identifying areas of improvement in requirement design.

average_movements.title: Average Movements
average_movements.description: Represents the average number of times players moved each requirement during the classification process.
average_movements.formula: Average Movements = Total classification movements / Number of attempts
average_movements.interpretation: A higher number of movements may indicate indecision or difficulty in classification. This can signal the need to reinforce classification criteria.

progress_percentage.title: Progress Percentage
progress_percentage.description: Measures the overall progress of players in classifying all game requirements.
progress_percentage.formula: Progress Percentage = (Correctly classified requirements / Total requirements) √ó 100
progress_percentage.interpretation: Represents the game completion level for each player. A 100% indicates that all requirements have been correctly classified.

confirmation.title: Log Out
confirmation.message: Are you sure you want to log out?

errors.title: Error
errors.message: An error occurred while logging out. Please try again.
